name: Ethiopian Yirgacheffe
longDescription: A delicate and aromatic light roastwith hints of lemon, jasmine, and berries. Grown at high altitudes, this coffee is loved for its complex and wine-like notes.

name: Jamaican Blue Mountain
longDescription: One of the most prized coffees globally, it's ultra-smooth, low in acidity, and boasts notes of chocolate and floral undertones. Ideal for a refined palate.

name: Kona Coffee (Hawaii)
longDescription: Grown on the slopes of Hawaii’s Mauna Loa, Kona is smooth and mellow, with light acidity, a buttery body, and subtle nut and caramel notes.

name: Colombian Supremo
longDescription: A classic medium roastwith a full body, rich aroma, and deep chocolate undertones. Great for everyday drinkers who want consistency and flavor.

name: Guatemalan Antigua
longDescription: Known for its full body and spicy notes, this coffee offers hints of cocoa, cinnamon, and sometimes even toffee. Grown in volcanic soil.

name: Panama Geisha
longDescription: A legendary and award-winning bean with jasmine, bergamot, and tropical fruit notes. Pricey, but renowned for its elegance and clean finish.

name: Sumatra Mandheling
longDescription: Full-bodied and low-acid with notes of earth, cocoa, and tobacco. Often a favorite for those who like bold and intense brews.

name: Kenyan AA
longDescription: High-acidity coffee with bright berry and citrus flavors, often with a winey aftertaste. AA signifies the largest, most premium beans.

name: Costa Rican Tarrazu
longDescription: A smooth cup with crisp acidity and subtle citrus and honey notes. Great for a morning brew that isn’t too overpowering.

name: Brazilian Santos
longDescription: Brazil’s classic export, this coffee is mellow, low-acid, with chocolate and nutty tones. Works great for blends or espresso bases.

name: Hawaiian Maui
longDescription: A medium-bodied island coffee with light acidity and notes of passionfruit and floral undertones. Less famous than Kona but delightful.

name: Tanzanian Peaberry
longDescription: Peaberries are small, round beans with intense, bright fruit flavors like blackcurrant and apricot. Bold and sharp in a good way.

name: Sulawesi Toraja
longDescription: Known for its rustic, bold profile with hints of dark chocolate, cedar, and spice. It’s complex, with a syrupy mouthfeel.

name: Ethiopian Sidamo
longDescription: Offers bright acidity with blueberry and lemon notes, and a light body. Naturally processed for layered flavors.

name: Yunnan Golden Monkey (China)
longDescription: A unique Asian origin, with balanced acidity, mild earthiness, and light floral notes. Gaining popularity as specialty coffee.

name: Blue Bottle Coffee (blend)
longDescription: Blue Bottle’s signature blends are smooth and carefully roasted, often combining African brightness with Latin American body.

name: Stumptown Hair Bender
longDescription: A well-known house blend with a heavy body and deep chocolate and cinnamon notes. Great as espresso or French press.

name: Intelligentsia Black Cat
longDescription: An espresso-focused blend, delivering dark fruit, chocolate, and caramel in a silky, punchy profile. Consistent and bold.

name: Lavazza Gran Aroma
longDescription: Italian-style medium roastwith floral and fruity undertones. Great for those who want a refined but affordable cup.

name: Illy Espresso
longDescription: A premium Italian espresso known for its smooth, creamy mouthfeel and balance of bitterness and sweetness.

name: Peet’s Major Dickason’s Blend
longDescription: A classic dark roastwith rich, bold flavor and notes of spice and dark chocolate. Robust and satisfying for dark roastlovers.

name: Death Wish Coffee
longDescription: Marketed as the “world’s strongest coffee,” it’s ultra-caffeinated but surprisingly smooth with nutty and chocolate notes.

name: Verve Streetlevel
longDescription: A blend known for fruity notes and a clean, round body. Sweet with hints of citrus and a silky finish.

name: La Colombe Corsica
longDescription: Hearty and bold with a dark cocoa body and roasted finish. Works well for milk-based drinks like lattes and cappuccinos.

name: Blue Mountain Blend (various)
longDescription: Typically a blend of Blue Mountain with other origins. Offers mellow acidity, a creamy body, and soft nutty-sweetness.
